page.title: 16Footpaths Around Staplehurst
page.content: A glance at the map will tell the walker that the countryside around Staplehurst has a wealth of footpaths. These are regularly walked by the local footpath society who publish maps and guides for circular walks. In 1977 the Jubilee walks were devised from existing paths with any gaps filled in by courtesy of landowners. The walks are rewarding in that local farming methods being fairly tradit- ional,field sizes have remained small and therefore hedgerows and trees are plentiful and always close at hand. This is the intimate countryside in which one can easily lose oneself and is such a contrast to the Kentish mini prairies produced by some farmers. It is further enhanced by the numerous picturesque dew ponds, scattered orchards and now,sadly,only the occas- ional hop field.
